t: Psalm 73
Book Three
God Is My Strength and Portion Forever
A Psalm of Asaph.
Truly*pn God is good to Israel, to*ld those who are pure in heart.
But*ln as for me, my feet had almost stumbled, my*ld steps had nearly slipped.
For*ln I was envious of the arrogant when*ld I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
For*pn they have no pangs until death; their*ld bodies are fat and sleek.
They*ln are not in trouble as others are; they*ld are not stricken like the rest of mankind.
Therefore*ln pride is their necklace; violence*ld covers them as a garment.
Their*ln eyes swell out through fatness; their*ld hearts overflow with follies.
They*ln scoff and speak with malice; loftily*ld they threaten oppression.
They*ln set their mouths against the heavens, and*ld their tongue struts through the earth.
Therefore*ln his people turn back to them, and*ld find no fault in them.
And*ln they say, “How can God know? Is*ld there knowledge in the Most High?”
Behold,*ln these are the wicked; always*ld at ease, they increase in riches.
All*ln in vain have I kept my heart clean and*ld washed my hands in innocence.
For*ln all the day long I have been stricken and*ld rebuked every morning.
If*ln I had said, “I will speak thus,” I*ld would have betrayed the generation of your children.
But*pn when I thought how to understand this, it*ld seemed to me a wearisome task,
until*ln I went into the sanctuary of God; then*ld I discerned their end.
Truly*pn you set them in slippery places; you*ld make them fall to ruin.
How*ln they are destroyed in a moment, swept*ld away utterly by terrors!
Like*ln a dream when one awakes, O*ld Lord, when you rouse yourself, you despise them as phantoms.
When*ln my soul was embittered, when*ld I was pricked in heart,
I*ln was brutish and ignorant; I*ld was like a beast toward you.
Nevertheless,*pn I am continually with you; you*ld hold my right hand.
You*ln guide me with your counsel, and*ld afterward you will receive me to glory.
Whom*ln have I in heaven but you? And*ld there is nothing on earth that I desire besides you.
My*ln flesh and my heart may fail, but*ld God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever.
For*pn behold, those who are far from you shall perish; you*ld put an end to everyone who is unfaithful to you.
But*ln for me it is good to be near God; I*ld have made the Lord God*s my refuge, that*ld I may tell of all your works.
